doc.ContractDescription: SAP PURCHASE REQUISITION: 4200587515 AMONG THE MOST URGENT PROBLEMS FACING TODAY'S SOCIETY IS THE IMPACT OF INCREASING GLOBAL DEMAND FOR RESOURCES ON CLIMATE AND THE ENVIRONMENT. TO FIND INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS TO THIS AND OTHER CHALLENGES, IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT TOMORROW'S SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS LEARN TO INTEGRATE SKILLS AND IDEAS FROM SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING, AS WELL AS ECONOMICS AND THE SOCIAL SCIENCES INTO THEIR THINKING. WE WILL ADDRESS THESE SOCIETAL AND EDUCATIONAL IMPERATIVES THROUGH AN INNOVATIVE DESIGN PROJECT THAT BUILDS STUDENTS' SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING AND ENGINEERING SKILLS IN THE CONTEXT OF THE DESIGN AND FABRICATION OF A CUTTING-EDGE INSTRUMENT FOR MEASUREMENT OF ATMOSPHERIC TRACE GASES. SPECIFICALLY, STUDENTS WILL BUILD AN INTEGRATED CAVITY OUTPUT SPECTROMETER (ICOS) TO PROVIDE MEASUREMENTS THAT CHARACTERIZE THE EFFECT OF CHANGING CLIMATE ON HALOGEN CATALYTIC CHEMISTRY AND OZONE IN THE UPPER TROPOSPHERE AND LOWER STRATOSPHERE. STUDENTS WILL EXECUTE THE ENTIRE DESIGN PROCESS, FROM SCIENTIFIC REQUIREMENTS THROUGH POST-FLIGHT ANALYSIS, ADDRESSING OPTICAL, MECHANICAL, ELECTRONIC, AND SOFTWARE CHALLENGES AS WELL AS DESIGN METHODOLOGIES AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT. THIS ENDEAVOR WILL EXPAND ON THE PROJECT-BASED DESIGN COURSE (ES96) THAT WE HAVE OFFERED IN PAST YEARS, IN WHICH STUDENTS PRODUCED A WORKING PROTOTYPE BY THE END OF THE SEMESTER. THROUGH SUMMER AND SEMESTER INTERNSHIPS, SENIOR THESES AND INDEPENDENT RESEARCH PROJECTS, THE USIP PROGRAM WILL ALLOW THIS YEAR'S ES96 STUDENTS TO CARRY THEIR DESIGN BEYOND A PROTOTYPE TO A FULLY-FUNCTIONAL FLIGHT. WE PROPOSE A SERIES OF TEST AND SCIENCE FLIGHTS OF THE USIP INSTRUMENT ON ZERO-PRESSURE BALLOONS, ALTHOUGH THE INSTRUMENT WOULD ALSO BE SUITED TO AIRCRAFT AND LONG-DURATION BALLOONS.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF LABOR-RR YEAR 1

WE PLAN TO DEVELOP A SPACECRAFT DESIGN CURRICULUM IN OUR HONORS COLLEGE AND USE THE PROPOSED MISSION ABOARD A CUBESAT PLATFORM AS ITS LABORATORY COMPONENT. DURING THE TWO YEARS OF THIS PROJECT, UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WUI GAIN HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE IN A BROAD RANGE OF SPACEFLIGHT TECHNOLOGY TOPICS, SUCH AS, SPACECRAFT AND INSTRUMENT DESIGN, HARDWARE DEVELOPMENT, CONTROL THEORY, INTEGRATION AND TESTS, AND REMOTE SPACECRAFT OPERATIONS, AS WELL AS DATA ANALYSIS. THE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WITH DIFFERENT BACKGROUNDS, FOR EXAMPLE, SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING, WILL TEAM UP AND PARTICIPATE IN THIS RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT EFFORT FOR THE EQUIVALENT OF TWO COURSES. GRADUATE STUDENTS INVOLVED IN ON GOING SPACEFLIGHT MISSIONS FOR THEIR PH.D. DISSERTATION WORK WILL SERVE AS MENTORS TO THE STUDENT TEAMS. SPACE HAUC'S FACULTY TEAM INCLUDES MEMBERS WHO LED A STUDENT LAUNCH PROGRAM SOUNDING ROCKET EXPERIMENT,SPECTRE, NUMEROUS SOUNDING ROCKET AND BALLOON EXPERIMENTS, AND HELD LEADERSHIP ROLES IN A UNIVERSITY CLASS EXPLORER MISSION, TERRIERS. IN ADDITION TO THE UMASS LOWELL ADMINISTRATION, WE ARE FORTUNATE TO RECEIVE STRONG SUPPORT FROM TWO WORLD RENOWNED AEROSPACE ORGANIZATIONS. BAE SYSTEMS HAS PLEDGED TO ALLOW US USE THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL FACILITIES AT NO COST. IN ADDITION, A SYSTEMS ENGINEER FROM CHARLES STARK DRAPER LABORATORY AND THREE VETERAN ENGINEERS FROM BAE SYSTEMS WILL MENTOR THE STUDENTS AND PARTICIPATE SIDE BY SIDE WITH THE UMASS LOWELL TEAM TO MAKE SPACE HAUC AN UNQUALIFIED SUCCESS.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF EXERCISE OPTION YEAR 1

SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAINTIES IN THE RATE COEFFICIENTS OF SEVERAL KEY BROMINE REACTIONS LIMIT THE ACCURACY WITH WHICH THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY CAN MODEL STRATOSPHERIC OZONE LOSSES AND PROJECT FUTURE OZONE CHANGES. THE KINETICS OF THE BROMINE REACTIONS KNOWN TO BE MOST LIMITING WILL BE STUDIED IN TWO SETS OF EXPERIMENTS OVER A RANGE OF TEMPERATURES AND PRESSURES RELEVANT TO THE ATMOSPHERE: ONE SET FOR THE OVERALL RATE AND THREE PRODUCT CHANNELS OF THE BRO + CLO REACTION AND A SECOND SET FOR THE TWO BR ATOM REACTIONS WITH O3 AND NO. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS STUDY IS TO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING OF THESE BROMINE REACTIONS AND REDUCE UNCERTAINTY IN THE RATE COEFFICIENTS, EMPLOYING NEW DETECTION TECHNIQUES AND EXPERIMENTAL METHODS. PRIMARY DETECTION OF REACTANTS AND PRODUCTS FOR THE BRO + CLO REACTION WILL BE WITH CAVITY-ENHANCED ABSORPTION SPECTROSCOPY (CEAS) BOTH IN THE UV-VIS AND IR WITH MEASUREMENTS MADE RADIALLY IN THE FLOW SYSTEM. ATOMIC RESONANCE FLUORESCENCE WILL PROVIDE AN INDEPENDENT MEASURE OF BRO AND CLO CONCENTRATIONS. A MOVEABLE INJECTOR SETS THE REACTION TIME, AND A VARIETY OF SOURCE CHEMISTRIES WILL BE USED. THE KINETICS OF THE BR ATOM REACTIONS WILL BE PERFORMED USING THE HIGH PRESSURE FLOW TECHNIQUE, IN WHICH THE FLOW TUBE IS EFFECTIVELY WALL-LESS. FOUR BR DETECTION AXES WITH LAMP HOUSINGS AND PMT DETECTORS SPACED IN THE FLOW SYSTEM ELIMINATE THE NEED FOR A MOVEABLE INJECTOR. RESONANCE FLUORESCENCE PROVIDES FOR HIGHLY SENSITIVE AND SELECTIVE DETECTION OF BR ATOMS. HIGHLIGHTS OF OUR BRO + CLO EXPERIMENT INCLUDE: (1) CEAS IS A HIGHLY SENSITIVE AND SELECTIVE METHOD FOR DETECTION OF HALOGEN MOLECULES; IT IS A DIFFERENT TECHNIQUE FROM WHAT HAS BEEN USED BEFORE. (2) WHILE THE BRO + CLO REACTION IS COMPLEX, KINETIC MODELING HAS ENABLED IDENTIFICATION OF OPTIMAL CONDITIONS TO ELIMINATE SECONDARY CHEMISTRY IN A MORE EFFECTIVE WAY THAN IN PAST STUDIES. (3) INFRARED DETECTION OF C2H3CL OR HCL AS A SURROGATE FOR CL WILL PROVIDE THE FIRST INDEPENDENT MEASUREMENT OF THE CLOO CHANNEL RATE COEFFICIENT, WHICH IS THE MOST IMPORTANT CHANNEL FOR O3 LOSS BUT HAS NEVER BEEN DIRECTLY MEASURED. FOR THE BR-ATOM EXPERIMENTS, A MAJOR REDUCTION IN THE KINETICS UNCERTAINTIES IS ANTICIPATED, E.G., BR + NO HAS NEVER BEEN STUDIED AT COLD TEMPERATURES, AND THE ONLY TWO ROOM TEMPERATURE VALUES DISAGREE BY A FACTOR OF 8. THIS PROPOSAL IS DIRECTLY RESPONSIVE TO NASA'S SOLICITATION FOR LABORATORY KINETIC STUDIES OVER A RANGE OF EARTH'S TEMPERATURE AND PRESSURE THAT DESCRIBE THE ATMOSPHERIC TRANSFORMATIONS OF TRACE SPECIES INVOLVED IN OZONE CHEMISTRY, AND THIS PROPOSAL SUPPORTS THE ACTIVITIES OF THE NASA JPL PANEL FOR DATA EVALUATION, WHICH IS STATED TO BE AN AREA OF PARTICULAR INTEREST. ADDITIONALLY MOTIVATING THE PROPOSED WORK IS A RECENT STUDY ON THE IMPACT OF CHEMICAL KINETICS PARAMETERS ON CALCULATIONS OF STRATOSPHERIC OZONE LOSS [KAWA ET AL., 2009], WHICH CONCLUDED THAT UNCERTAINTY IN THE KEY CHEMICAL REACTION KINETICS MUST BE REDUCED FOR THE SET OF BROMINE REACTIONS PROPOSED HERE. THE ONLY BROMINE KINETICS STUDY TO EMERGE SINCE THAT PUBLICATION HAS ONLY FURTHER INCREASED THE UNCERTAINTY, REPORTING AN OVERALL RATE COEFFICIENT FOR THE BRO + CLO REACTION MORE THAN 100% FASTER THAN THE CURRENT JPL RECOMMENDATION. IF CORRECT, THIS HAS PROFOUND IMPLICATIONS, AS BRO + CLO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR A SUBSTANTIAL FRACTION OF STRATOSPHERIC OZONE LOSS. BY SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING UNCERTAINTIES IN BROMINE REACTION KINETICS IN THE PROPOSED STUDY, THE ACCURACY OF ATMOSPHERIC MODELS WILL BE IMPROVED, THE WEALTH OF FIELD DATA ALREADY COLLECTED CAN BE BETTER INTERPRETED, AND PROJECTIONS OF FUTURE OZONE CHANGES WILL BE MORE TRUSTED. THE POSSIBLE DETRIMENTAL IMPACTS ON OZONE DUE TO EARTH'S RAPIDLY CHANGING CLIMATE, ALONG WITH A NEED TO UNDERSTAND THE POTENTIALLY SERIOUS CONSEQUENCES FOR OZONE IF GEOENGINEERING WERE INITIATED, FURTHER MAKE THE CASE FOR IMPROVING BROMINE KINETICS DATA.

doc.ContractDescription: FMS MK39 MOD 2 EMATT TARGETS
IGF::OT::IGF. AGUADILLA CMA/CXA SERVICES. THIS MODIFICATION EXTENDS THE TASK ORDER TO 10/31/15 AND DEOBLIGATES FUNDS FOR A CHANGE IN COMMISSIONING SUBCONTRACTOR.
IGF::OT::IGF IWR PROJECT ENTITLED "NAVIGATION DATA INTEGRATION AND MODERNIZATION"
4532163819!MODULAR INSULATED L

A MANIFESTATION OF PLANETARY DIFFERENTIATION IS THE DYNAMO PROCESS, THE INDUCTIVE GENERATION OF MAGNETIC FIELDS IN FLUID CORES. ALTHOUGH THE MOON TODAY HAS NO GLOBAL MAGNETIC FIELD, IT HAS BEEN KNOWN SINCE THE APOLLO ERA THAT LUNAR ROCKS ARE MAGNETIZED. UNTIL RECENTLY, IT WAS UNCLEAR WHETHER THIS MAGNETIZATION WAS THE PRODUCT OF A CORE DYNAMO OR FIELDS GENERATED EXTERNALLY TO THE MOON. RECENTLY, MAGNETIC MEASUREMENTS HAVE PROVIDED STRONG EVIDENCE THAT MUCH OF LUNAR MAGNETIZATION WAS PRODUCED BY AN ANCIENT DYNAMO GENERATED BY ADVECTION OF THE METALLIC CORE. THIS HAS MAJOR IMPLICATIONS FOR THE MOONS ORIGIN, THERMAL HISTORY, AND INTERIOR STRUCTURE. FURTHERMORE, THE MOONS SMALL SIZE MAKES IT A UNIQUE LABORATORY FOR STUDYING THE PHYSICS OF DYNAMO GENERATION. POWER SOURCES PROPOSED FOR THE LUNAR DYNAMO RANGE FROM CORE CONVECTION (THE SOURCE OF EARTHS FIELD) TO EXOTIC MECHANISMS LIKE MECHANICAL STIRRING BY THE LUNAR MANTLE. IT NOW APPEARS THAT THE LUNAR DYNAMO PERSISTED FROM AT LEAST 4.25 TO 3.56 GA, WITH THE SURFACE FIELD REACHING AN INTENSITY SIMILAR TO THAT OF THE PRESENT EARTH. THE FIELD SUBSEQUENTLY DECLINED BY AT LEAST AN ORDER OF MAGNITUDE BY 3.3 GA. HOWEVER, THERE ARE AT LEAST TWO MAJOR REMAINING UNKNOWNS. FIRST, THE TIME WHEN THE DYNAMO FINALLY CEASED IS UNCERTAIN. ESTABLISHING WHEN THE DYNAMO ENDED IS EXTREMELY IMPORTANT BECAUSE IT COULD ENABLE DISCRIMINATION BETWEEN VARIOUS HYPOTHESIZED DYNAMO MECHANISMS. IN PARTICULAR, ONLY PRECESSION AND CORE CRYSTALLIZATION ARE THOUGHT TO BE ABLE TO POWER A DYNAMO BEYOND 3 GA, WHILE ONLY CORE CRYSTALLIZATION COULD POTENTIALLY SUPPORT A DYNAMO BEYOND 0.6 GA. ESTABLISHING WHICH DYNAMO MECHANISM OPERATED IS IMPORTANT BECAUSE IT WOULD CONSTRAIN THE LUNAR THERMAL AND ORBITAL EVOLUTION. SECOND, THE PALEOINTENSITY OF THE LATE LUNAR FIELD IS POORLY CONSTRAINED. BECAUSE LUNAR SAMPLES OXIDIZE WHEN HEATED IN AIR, MOST PREVIOUS PALEOINTENSITY DETERMINATIONS HAVE EMPLOYED NON-THERMAL TECHNIQUES, WHICH TYPICALLY HAVE UNCERTAINTIES OF A FACTOR OF 3. DESPITE THESE LIMITATIONS, THESE STUDIES SUGGEST THAT THE FIELD BEFORE 3.5 GA WAS AT LEAST SEVERAL TIMES STRONGER THAN IS PREDICTED BY TYPICAL SCALING LAWS INFERRED FROM CONVECTION-DRIVEN NUMERICAL DYNAMO MODELS. LABORATORY HEATING TECHNIQUES COULD PROVIDE HIGHLY ACCURATE PALEOINTENSITIES (<10% UNCERTAINTY) IF THERMALLY-INDUCED SAMPLE ALTERATION COULD BE MITIGATED. ACCURATE PALEOINTENSITY MEASUREMENTS ARE VERY IMPORTANT FOR TWO REASONS. THEY COULD ENABLE DISCRIMINATION BETWEEN VARIOUS PROPOSED DYNAMO MECHANISMS. FURTHERMORE, THEY WILL TEST THE VALIDITY OF EXISTING DYNAMO SCALING LAWS, WHICH PREDICT FIELDS MOSTLY BELOW THIS THRESHOLD. HERE WE PROPOSE TO CONSTRAIN THE LATE HISTORY AND TERMINATION OF THE LUNAR DYNAMO BY ANALYZING THE PALEOMAGNETISM OF YOUNG [~0 TO 3.35 BILLION YEAR (GA) OLD] LUNAR ROCKS. OUR TWO GOALS ARE TO DETERMINE THE (1) INTENSITY AND (2) LIFETIME OF THE LATE LUNAR DYNAMO. WE WILL TARGET GLASSY APOLLO REGOLITH BRECCIAS WHICH WE HAVE FOUND HAVE EXCEPTIONAL MAGNETIC RECORDING PROPERTIES. AS PART OF AN ASSOCIATED PLANETARY MAJOR EQUIPMENT (PME) GRANT, WE WILL CONSTRUCT A NEXT-GENERATION GAS-MIXING THERMAL DEMAGNETIZER (GMTD) THAT CONTROLS OXYGEN FUGACITY. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE USED TO OBTAIN MORE ACCURATE THERMAL PALEOINTENSITY ESTIMATES BY MITIGATING SAMPLE ALTERATION. OUR CONSTRAINTS ON THE HISTORY OF THE LUNAR DYNAMO FIT WITHIN THE NASA SOLAR SYSTEM WORKINGS (SSW) PROGRAMMATIC SCOPE OF UNDERSTANDING PLANETARY MAGNETISM, INCLUDING THE CONFIGURATION OF PLANETARY MAGNETIC FIELDS AND HOW AND WHY THEY FORMED AND VARY THROUGH TIME. OUR METHODOLOGICAL APPROACH OF STUDYING APOLLO SAMPLES IS CONSISTENT WITH THE SSW PROGRAMS GOAL OF SUPPORTING SAMPLE-BASED STUDIES OF EXTRATERRESTRIAL MATERIALS. BROADER IMPACTS INCLUDE TRAINING OF TWO STUDENTS AND A POSTDOCTORAL ASSOCIATE AND DEVELOPING TECHNIQUES FOR RADIOMETRIC DATING OF YOUNG LUNAR SAMPLES

doc.ProductorServiceCode: J066: MAINT/REPAIR/REBUILD OF EQUIPMENT- INSTRUMENTS AND LABORATORY EQUIPMENT

doc.ContractDescription: THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO OBSERVE AND UNDERSTAND RADIATING BAROTROPIC AND BAROCLINIC ROSSBY WAVES IN THE WORLD OCEANS. OUR EMPHASIS WILL BE ON THE PROPERTIES AND CONSEQUENCES OF WAVES THAT RADIATE AWAY FROM REGIONS OF VIGOROUS INSTABILITY, E.G., MIDLATITUDE WESTERN BOUNDARY CURRENTS AND EQUATORIAL CURRENTS. THE DATA ANALYSIS WILL DRAW PRIMARILY ON ALONG-TRACK AND GRIDDED ALTIMETRY PRODUCTS AND WILL BE COMPLEMENTED BY THEORETICAL AND NUMERICAL ANALYSIS. OUR HYPOTHESIS IS THAT REGIONS OF ESPECIALLY VIGOROUS INSTABILITY (THE MAJOR WESTERN BOUNDARY CURRENTS, THE SOUTHERN OCEAN, AND THE EQUATORIAL CURRENT SYSTEMS) RADIATE ENERGY INTO THE MORE QUIESCENT OCEAN INTERIOR (PEDLOSKY, 1977; HARRISON AND ROBINSON, 1979), AND THAT THIS NONLOCAL EFFECT OF INSTABILITIES CONTRIBUTES TO THE EDDY FIELD AND OTHER VARIABILITY IN LESS ENERGETIC, INTERIOR REGIONS OF THE OCEANS. SOME EVIDENCE FOR NONLOCAL INFLUENCE OF GULF STREAM INSTABILITIES OF THIS SORT WAS DISCUSSED BY BOWER AND HOGG (1992). THAT STUDY WAS BASED ON ISOLATED, MOORED VELOCITY RECORDS. WHILE THE STATISTICAL EVIDENCE OF REMOTELY FORCED RADIATION AT THE MOORING SITES IS IN SOME WAYS QUITE DETAILED, IT IS NEVERTHELESS NOT PARTICULARLY COMPELLING OR LUCID BECAUSE THE PROPAGATION PATH OF THE WAVES COULD NOT BE DIRECTLY TRACED BACK TO THE GENERATION SITE WITH FIELD DATA EXISTING IN THE 1980S. THE MODERN ALTIMETRY RECORD CAN ENABLE NEW PROGRESS IN UNDERSTANDING THE EXTENT TO WHICH RADIATION FROM THE MAJOR UNSTABLE CURRENT SYSTEMS CONTRIBUTES TO VARIABILITY ELSEWHERE. A RECENT EXAMPLE OF THE PROMISE OF SATELLITE ALTIMETRY FOR SHEDDING LIGHT ON RADIATING INSTABILITIES COMES FROM AN ANALYSIS BY FARRAR (2011), WHICH SHOWED THAT FORMATION OF TROPICAL INSTABILITY WAVES (TIWS) IN THE EQUATORIAL PACIFIC LEADS TO NORTHWARD RADIATION OF BAROTROPIC ROSSBY WAVES. THAT ANALYSIS SHOWED THAT SEA LEVEL VARIABILITY NEAR HAWAII IS COHERENT WITH SEA LEVEL SOME 1600 KM CLOSER TO THE EQUATOR IN THE ZONAL-WAVENUMBER/ FREQUENCY BANDS ASSOCIATED WITH TIWS. THE SEA LEVEL SIGNAL IS TRANSMITTED NORTHWARD VIA BAROTROPIC ROSSBY WAVES. THESE WAVES ARE PRESENT TO AT LEAST 20 N, AND NEW PRELIMINARY EVIDENCE DISCUSSED HERE SUGGESTS THE WAVES MAY BE AN IMPORTANT SIGNAL ALL THE WAY NORTH TO THE GULF OF ALASKA. THE PROPOSED WORK WOULD USE THE ALTIMETRY DATA IN A NOVEL WAY TO ALLOW INSIGHT INTO THE EXISTENCE, PROPERTIES, AND DYNAMICS OF RADIATING, WAVE-LIKE VARIABILITY IN THE WORLD OCEANS. THE BASIC IDEA OF THE ANALYSIS APPROACH IS TO PERFORM CROSSSPECTRAL CALCULATIONS BETWEEN LOCATIONS OF VIGOROUS INSTABILITY AND ALL OTHER LOCATIONS TO ISOLATE DISTANT SIGNALS ASSOCIATED WITH RADIATION FROM THE INSTABILITIES. WE PLAN TO START WITH A DETAILED OBSERVATIONAL AND THEORETICAL PROCESS STUDY OF THE NORTHWARD RADIATION FROM THE UNSTABLE EQUATORIAL CURRENTS. OUR PRELIMINARY RESULTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE HYPOTHESIS THAT THE INSTABILITY OF THE EQUATORIAL CURRENT SYSTEM AND ITS SUBSEQUENT NORTHWARD RADIATION OF 30-DAY BAROTROPIC ROSSBY WAVES FILLS THE NORTH PACIFIC WITH BAROTROPIC, 30- DAY VARIABILITY, BUT THE AMPLITUDE AND PHASE OF THIS VARIABILITY IS INFLUENCED IN A COMPLICATED WAY BY REFRACTION, REFLECTION, AND WAVE INTERFERENCE. LATER IN THE PROJECT, WE WILL USE THE INSIGHTS OBTAINED FROM THE PROCESS STUDY TO EXAMINE RADIATION FROM OTHER MAJOR UNSTABLE CURRENTS OF THE WORLD OCEANS.
doc.MajorAgency: ASPECTS OF WAVE RADIATION IN THE WORLD OCEANS

doc.ProductorServiceCode: D306: IT AND TELECOM- SYSTEMS ANALYSIS

doc.ContractDescription: 4535042148!HYDRATE LIME POWDER PRICED PER TONBREACH

THE INCREASINGLY RAPID GROWTH OF SENSING, NAVIGATION, COMMUNICATION, HARDWARE, AND SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES HAS SPURRED AN INCREASE IN THE DECISION-MAKING AND DECISION-SUPPORT CAPABILITIES OF MODERN INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEMS. THE AIR TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM INVOLVES INTERACTIONS AMONG MULTIPLE DIVERSE STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUDING THE AIRLINES, AIR TRAFFIC CONTROLLERS, AIRPORT OPERATORS, TRAFFIC MANAGERS, CREW MEMBERS, GROUND HANDLERS AND PASSENGERS, TO NAME JUST A FEW. EACH OF THESE STAKEHOLDERS HAS THEIR OWN OBJECTIVES AND OPERATIONAL CONSTRAINTS, AND MAY OR MAY NOT COOPERATE OR COORDINATE WITH EACH OTHER, DEPENDING ON THE SITUATION. WHILE ADVANCED CONTROL AND OPTIMIZATION ALGORITHMS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO IMPROVE SYSTEM PERFORMANCE, PRACTICAL CHALLENGES REMAIN DUE TO THE LARGE SCALE AND COMPLEX NATURE OF OPERATIONS, MANY SOURCES OF UNCERTAINTIES, AND COMPETITION AMONG STAKEHOLDERS. THE INTRODUCTION OF UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS IN THE NATIONAL AIRSPACE SYSTEM WILL RESULT IN EVEN MORE DIVERSE LEVELS OF ONBOARD AUTONOMY, AND A NEW STAKEHOLDER COMMUNITY. THE EFFICIENT INTEGRATION OF UAS INTO THE NAS REQUIRES AIR TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS THAT ARE ABLE TO DISTRIBUTE RESPONSIBILITIES, WHILE STILL ENSURING SAFETY AND MAXIMIZING EFFICIENCY, UNDER BOTH NOMINAL AND OFF NOMINAL CIRCUMSTANCES. THE PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCES IN SENSING, COMMUNICATIONS AND COMPUTATION CAN HELP OVERCOME THESE CHALLENGES BY ENABLING DISTRIBUTED DECISION-MAKING BY STAKEHOLDERS, AND BY PROVIDING BETTER DECISION SUPPORT TOOLS TO SYSTEM OPERATORS. THE OVERARCHING PHILOSOPHY DRIVING THE RESEARCH PROPOSED IN THE AUTONOMY AND AUTONOMICITY ENHANCED AIR TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT PROJECT IS THAT, BY APPROPRIATELY LEVERAGING AUTONOMY AND AUTONOMICITY, THE ATM SYSTEM CAN: BETTER UTILIZE AVAILABLE CAPACITY, AND INCREASE THE AVAILABLE CAPACITY, ESPECIALLY DURING MARGINAL METEOROLOGICAL CONDITIONS, AT CRITICALLY CONGESTED AIRPORTS AND TERMINALAREAS. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE PROPOSED WORK ARE TO: IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES TO ENHANCE AIR TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT SYSTEM PERFORMANCE BY LEVERAGING TECHNIQUES FOR AUTONOMY AND AUTONOMICITY. CONDUCT A GAP ANALYSIS OF TECHNOLOGY AND RESEARCH NEEDS. CONDUCT A RISK-BENEFIT ANALYSIS FOR THE INCREASED USE OF AUTONOMY AND AUTONOMICITY IN NAS OPERATIONS. DEVELOP AND DEMONSTRATE PROTOTYPE ALGORITHMS FOR TRAFFIC FLOW MANAGEMENT AND CLOSELY SPACED RUNWAY OPERATIONS IN THE PRESENCE OF UNCERTAINTIES, TO HELP ACHIEVE THE POTENTIAL BENEFITS OF INCREASED AUTONOMY AND AUTONOMICITY. LAYOUT A RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY ROADMAP TO ACHIEVE AUTONOMY AND AUTONOMICITY ENHANCED AIR TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT. THE ABOVE OBJECTIVES WILL BE TACKLED IN THE CONTEXT OF BOTH SYSTEM-WIDE AND FACILITY SPECIFIC OPERATIONS, AND A RANGE OF TIME-SCALES.

doc.ContractDescription: LAND SURFACE ALBEDO AND THE RELATED SURFACE REFLECTANCE ANISOTROPY AS DESCRIBED BY THE BIDIRECTIONAL REFLECTANCE DISTRIBUTION FUNCTION OR BRDF IS AN ESSENTIAL CLIMATE VARIABLE ECV REQUIRED BY GLOBAL AND REGIONAL CLIMATE AND BIOGEOCHEMICAL MODELS. THUS ALBEDO BRDF HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED AS A KEY LAND PRODUCT FOR BOTH THE MODIS EOS RECORD AND THE SUOMI-NPP VIIRS RECORD. UNFORTUNATELY THE NOAA DERIVED VIIRS ALBEDO PRODUCT ONLY PROVIDES A SINGLE DAILY BROADBAND ALBEDO VALUE WITH NO ACCOMPANYING BRDF INFORMATION. IT ALSO DOES NOT OFFER ANY PER BAND VALUES TO CAPTURE THE SURFACE RADIATION EFFECTS OF THE PHOTOSYNTHETICALLY ACTIVE SHORTWAVE, THE NEAR-INFRARED, OR THE SHORTWAVE INFRARED, ALL WIDELY USED FOR THE CANOPY STRUCTURE STUDIES. THIS NOAA ALBEDO PRODUCT IS EXTREMELY RUDIMENTARY REPRESENTING LITTLE MORE THAN AN AVERAGE SURFACE REFLECTANCE FOR TIME OF OVERPASS WITH VIRTUALLY NO QUALITY OR UNCERTAINTY INFORMATION. IN CONTRAST THE MODIS ALBEDO/BRDF PRODUCTS ARE RIGOROUS PER PIXEL CHARACTERIZATIONS OF THE INTRINSIC SURFACE QUANTITIES WITH EXTENSIVE QUALITY AND UNCERTAINTY INFORMATION. THE EOS MODIS PRODUCTS HAVE BEEN EXTREMELY POPULAR WITH THE SCIENTIFIC AND APPLICATIONS COMMUNITIES WITH THE ALBEDO DATA BEING USED TO INITIALIZE AND TUNE CLIMATE MODELS AND MONITOR LAND, SNOW, AND ICE CONTRIBUTIONS TO SURFACE RADIATIVE FORCING. THE VIEW ANGLE CORRECTED NADIR BRDF ADJUSTED REFLECTANCE NBAR VALUES ARE PARTICULARLY VALUED BY THE DIRECT BROADCAST COMMUNITY AND IN GENERAL ARE BEING USED TO DRIVE LAND COVER AND VEGETATION PHENOLOGY STUDIES AND MONITOR RANGE LANDS, AGRICULTURAL FIELDS, AND IMPACT OF VARIOUS DISTURBANCES. THE INTRINSIC BRDF INFORMATION IS BEING USED FOR STUDIES OF SURFACE STRUCTURE AND VARIATION AND IS ALSO USED TO PROVIDE A PRIORI SURFACE ANISOTROPY INFORMATION FOR OTHER SATELLITE SENSORS WITH LIMITED ANGULAR RANGE SUCH AS MERIS, LANDSAT, AND AWIFS AND FOR SATELLITE PRODUCTS SUCH AS CLOUD OPTICAL PROPERTIES, SURFACE TEMPERATURE AND EMISSIVITY, AEROSOL INFORMATION, AND LOW LIGHT IMAGERY. THE ALGORITHMS FOR DAILY BRDF ALBEDO/NBAR PRODUCTS RELY ON CLOUD FREE, MULTIDATE, MULTIANGLE SURFACE REFLECTANCE DATA TO CAPTURE APPROPRIATE BRDFS WITH PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON THE DAY OF INTEREST TO CAPTURE MORE THE RAPID DAILY VARIATIONS. THESE DAILY VALUES HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO PROVIDE IMPROVED MONITORING OF EXTREME ENVIRONMENTS AND RAPIDLY CHANGING SITUATIONS SUCH AS EPHEMERAL SNOW, SNOW MELT, COASTAL VARIATIONS, AND NATURAL AND ANTHROPOGENIC DISTURBANCES. THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO TRANSITION THE MODIS ERA DAILY ALGORITHMS FOR USE WITH THE VIIRS SENSOR WITH SPECIAL EMPHASIS ON THE DIFFERENT VIIRS CHANNELS, PIXEL RESOLUTIONS, AND UPSTREAM PROCESSES, AND ON THE PRODUCTION OF APPROPRIATE NARROW TO BROADBAND CONVERSIONS. EVALUATIONS WILL UTILIZE AVAILABLE AIRCRAFT AND FIELD DATA, PARTICULARLY OF CHALLENGING HIGH LATITUDE AND COASTAL ENVIRONMENTS, AND INTERCOMPARISONS WITH MODIS AND OTHER MULTI-ANGLE SATELLITE PRODUCTS E.G. SEVIRI, MISR WILL BE UNDERTAKEN UNDER THE PROTOCOLS OF THE CEOS WORKING GROUP ON CALVAL WGCV LAND PRODUCT VALIDATION LPV. ROBUST MEASURES OF UNCERTAINTY AND EXTENSIVE QUALITY FLAGS WILL ALSO BE PRODUCED TO PROVIDE CONSISTENT LONG TERM SUOMI NPP VIIRS BRDF ALBEDO NBAR PRODUCTS TO AUGMENT AND EXTEND THE EOS MODIS ERA RECORD.

doc.ContractDescription: BLANKET PURCHASE AGREEMENT (BPA) CALL ORDER TITLE: FISCAL YEAR (FY) 16/17 GLOBAL METHANE INITIATIVE (GMI) COAL SECTOR SUPPORT SERVICES (EXCLUSIVELY FOR TASK 1, 2,&3) THE PURPOSE OF THIS BPA CALL ORDER IS TO PROVIDE EPA'S COALBED METHANE OUTREACH PROGRAM (CMOP) WITH THE TECHNICAL, ANALYTIC, POLICY AND OUTREACH SUPPORT SERVICES TO ADVANCE CMOP'S INTERNATIONAL ACTIVITIES UNDER THE GLOBAL METHANE INITIATIVE (GMI). CMOP SEEKS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS AND ACTIVITIES OF THE GMI COAL SUBCOMMITTEE, AS WELL AS EPA'S INITIATIVES TO SUPPORT GMI THROUGH ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE CMM RECOVERY AND UTILIZATION PROJECTS IN PARTNER COUNTRIES. THIS ORDER COVERS THE FOLLOWING TASKS: TASK 1: PROJECT MANAGEMENT (PROPORTIONAL); TASK 2: TARGETED OUTREACH AND LOGISTICAL SUPPORT FOR THE GMI COAL SUBCOMMITTEE; AND TASK 3: ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT ENABLING POLICIES AND INCENTIVES FOR CMM PROJECTS IGF::OT::IGF
